fields.description:
The usage of Tomcat in Confluence on the Microsoft Windows operating system before version 7.0.5, from version 7.1.0 before version 7.1.1 allows local system attackers who have permission to write a dll file in a directory in the global path environmental variable variable to inject code & escalate their privileges via a DLL hijacking vulnerability.

h3. Acknowledgment

We would like to thank Peleg Hadar of SafeBreach Labs for reporting this vulnerability.
fields.summary: Confluence on Windows was vulnerable to DLL hijacking - CVE-2019-20406

fields.description:
Summary: Ability to change the default user filter from 10 users
h3. Problem

Under the _User Management_ > _Users_ option, if you change the filter from 10 to 100, navigate away and come back to this page, the user list defaults to 10 again.
h3. Suggested Solution

If we change the filter to display a number of users from 10 to any other number (20, 50, or 100), Confluence should be able to stick to those settings next time when the admin comes back to the _Users_ page.
h3. Why This Is Important

For a Confluence site with a large number of users, it can be ineffective for admins when Confluence always goes back to the default number 10, and they need to make changes to the list every time they visit the page.
h3. Workaround

N/A
fields.summary: User Management: Change Default Filter from 10 to 100 Users

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

JIRA Macro couldn't render issues when the filter contains multi-byte characters.
h3. Environment
 * Confluence 6.15.9 and 7.2.1
 * JIRA 8.1.0

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install JIRA 8.1.0
 # Create a project
 # Create two custom fields as follows
 ## Create a custom field with Russian characters (срок исполнения)
 ## Create another custom field with English characters(period of execution.)
 !image-2020-02-04-16-17-54-311.png|thumbnail!
 # Install Confluence 6.15.9 and integrate it with the JIRA
 # Create a space and a page
 # Use JIRA Macro with the following two types of custom fields
 # Check if the macro works fine in the preview dialog

h3. Expected Results

Even if we use Russian characters in the custom field, the issue should be rendered on the page as it works fine with the other custom fields which contain only English characters.
 !image-2020-02-04-16-27-58-182.png|thumbnail! 
 !image-2020-02-04-16-22-01-748.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

When we use Russin characters in the custom field, the issue wasn't rendered on the page correctly.
 !image-2020-02-04-16-21-31-983.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround
 # Stop Confluence
 # Add the following line into the {{setenv.sh}}/{{setenv.bat}} file
{panel:title=setenv.sh}
CATALINA_OPTS="-Dfile.encoding=UTF-8 ${CATALINA_OPTS}"
{panel}
{panel:title=setenv.bat}
set CATALINA_OPTS=-Dfile.encoding=UTF-8 %CATALINA_OPTS%
{panel}

 # Start Confluence
fields.summary: JIRA Macro couldn't render issues when the custom field contains multi-byte characters

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In Confluence Data Center 6.10 and above, the document conversion process should be handled by a "sandbox" - an external process pool that can crash or be timed out without impacting Confluence.  However, it appears that some spreadsheets that contain graphs can still be converted the old way, and can become stuck, eventually running cpu up to 100%.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Confluence Data Center 6.10 or above
 # Attach an XLS or XLSX that contains a graph to a page.

h3. Expected Results

When viewing the file in preview mode, Confluence should render the preview using the sandbox.
h3. Actual Results

Confluence will skip the sandbox, and attempt to generate the thumbnail using an HTTP thread, which may become permanently stuck, requiring a re-start.  The thread should report as stuck the Tomcat logs:

{code:title=catalina.out}
23-Jan-2020 08:16:24.416 WARNING [Catalina-utility-2] org.apache.catalina.valves.StuckThreadDetectionValve.notifyStuckThreadDetected Thread [http-nio-0.0.0.0-8090-exec-62] (id=[1760]) has been active for [69,192] milliseconds (since [1/23/20 8:15 AM]) to serve the same request for [https://confluence.example.com/display/ABC123/Test+Page?src=contextnavpagetreemode] and may be stuck (configured threshold for this StuckThreadDetectionValve is [60] seconds). There is/are [2] thread(s) in total that are monitored by this Valve and may be stuck.
	java.lang.Throwable
		at sun.java2d.pisces.Renderer.curveBreakIntoLinesAndAdd(Renderer.java:259)
		at sun.java2d.pisces.Renderer.curveTo(Renderer.java:395)
		at sun.java2d.pisces.Stroker.emitCurveTo(Stroker.java:487)
		at sun.java2d.pisces.Stroker.drawRoundCap(Stroker.java:277)
		at sun.java2d.pisces.Stroker.finish(Stroker.java:441)
		at sun.java2d.pisces.Stroker.moveTo(Stroker.java:348)
		at sun.java2d.pisces.Dasher.goTo(Dasher.java:155)
		at sun.java2d.pisces.Dasher.lineTo(Dasher.java:210)
		at sun.java2d.pipe.RenderingEngine.feedConsumer(RenderingEngine.java:366)
		at sun.java2d.pisces.PiscesRenderingEngine.pathTo(PiscesRenderingEngine.java:484)
		at sun.java2d.pisces.PiscesRenderingEngine.strokeTo(PiscesRenderingEngine.java:363)
		at sun.java2d.pisces.PiscesRenderingEngine.strokeTo(PiscesRenderingEngine.java:163)
		at sun.java2d.pisces.PiscesRenderingEngine.getAATileGenerator(PiscesRenderingEngine.java:562)
...
{code}

The above thread will never report as completed, even after hours.  Thread dumps will show the exact same stack trace as the above, indicating that Confluence is getting stuck during the conversion process.  

h3. Workaround

If you already have stuck threads such as the above, the only resolution is to re-start Confluence to release those threads. 

To prevent this from happening again, we recommend removing graphs from any XLS documents contained on pages. If you need to review pages to see which have graphs on them, it would be safest to Disable the XLS view file module to prevent any further performance issues while accessing these pages:

 # !https://confluence.atlassian.com/download/attachments/157679812/Cog.png?version=1&modificationDate=1361250253653&api=v2! -> General configuration -> Manage Apps
 # Select _System_ from the drop down menu and search for _Office Connector_
 # Select the Office Connector Plugin and expand. Click the *+* sign to reveal the underlying modules
 # Find the *{{viewxls}}* and *{{viewxls-legacy}}* modules and click Disable

At that point, visit the page noted in the stuck thread error log, and check for any XLSX or XLS files that may contain graphs.  Remove the graph, delete the attachment from Confluence, and re-upload the version without graphs.
fields.summary: XLSX files are not converted in the sandbox, and can get stuck and run CPU to 100%

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Page Link search changes the page link *"bienvenue à bord"* to *"bienvenue & agrave; bord"* and All encoding settings are utf8*.
  
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Step 1:- Create a page with the title *"bienvenue à bord"* and save the page.
 Step 2:- Insert a link in some other page and search a page *"bienvenue à bord"* and save the link.
 Step 3:- Now edit the link which has created in the last step, here the search box shows the *"bienvenue & agrave; bord"*.
h3. Expected Results

Page link search will not change to any other character and it should be *"bienvenue à bord"* .
h3. Actual Results

Here Page search box change the page from *"bienvenue à bord"* to *"bienvenue & agrave; bord"*

!Screenshot 2020-02-04 at 1.19.41 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

–
 Thanks,
 Hemant
fields.summary: Page Link search change the Latin Characters

fields.description:
Currently, Confluence has a very specific algorithm that it considers when returning Confluence Search Results. Sometimes, these results are not what the admin would expect OR are not as relevant to the admin. 

While we do have additional search syntax/refinements that can be leveraged to yield more relevant results to the user, it would be ideal if the admin themselves could assign value to certain assets such that they are surfaced more easily through a basic keyword search.
fields.summary: Allow Admins to influence search results through a mechanism available in the UI

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a user wants to share a Confluence page to a group, the user needs to know the exact name of the group. Currently, there are no preview of all available groups and the search feature for the groups is not smart enough to detect the full group name if the user input is a substring of the name. 

For example: In a Confluence instance with the following groups: hr group, finance group. If a user types "group" in the Add People field of the search dialog, Confluence will not retrieve the above groups as options the user can choose from. The user must start his search with "finance" in order for Confluence to retrieve finance group as one of the options.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Given a Confluence instance that has the following groups: finance group, hr group
** Navigate to a page and then click "Share"
** In the panel, under Add People, type group

 !Screen Shot 2018-06-12 at 10.16.49 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Confluence will give a list of all groups that has the text "group" in it. 

h3. Actual Results
Confluence does not retrieve any group. 

h5. Improvement Suggestions:
# Make group search "smart" enough to be able to retrieve all groups that has a particular sub-string from the search parameter.
# Display all groups in the dropdown for easy access.
fields.summary: Can't search on all parts of a group name when sharing page

fields.description:

h3. Expected Results

Editor should show both colour during collaborative editing.
h3. Actual Results

The behaviour of the editor is captured in this video.
 [https://drive.google.com/file/d/1SGJCvXvO7dbPuNGcwI3OBWYFMJBbHW0n/view]
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Collaborative Editing with different colours changes the text colour

fields.description:
h3. Problem:
In Confluence Server version 6.15.9 certain string combinations are not searchable.

h3. Environment
Confluence Server version 6.15.9

h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. In Confluence 6.15.9 create a page with a random title. Within the page, add a string "BE - Belt Extendible"

2. Save/Publish this page.

3. From the top right corner of Confluence Dashboard, search for Strings BE, BE*, BE - , BE - Belt Extendible.

h3. Expected Results
The page containing the String BE - Belt Extendible should be listed.

h3. Actual Results
The page is not listed for any of the combinations.

h3. Workaround
Remove the - and save or add another string with - removed

h3. Notes
fields.summary: Search Not Working Correctly for Certain String Combinations in Confluence  6.15.9

fields.description:
Atlassian Companion has had its version number incrementally updated as releases of the app have shipped. We have always considered the app to be stable, however, we have also received feedback that some customers will only trust mature software, which is indicated by a 1.x version release number. 

With the latest updates, we are also taking the opportunity to release Companion with a 1.0.0 version number to reassure teams that Companion is trusted for production use.

Makisa | Senior Product Manager, Confluence Server and Data Center
fields.summary: Release v1.0 of Atlassian Companion

fields.description:
{panel:title=Issues fixed in ATST (1.23.3)}
# The fix for this bug has been released in the ATST 1.23.3 plugin.
# Updating the app from the *Manage Apps* page should fix this issue. 
{panel}


h3. Issue Summary

Users that have updated to the latest ATST version available in the marketplace, that was 1.23.1, may receive a failed health check regarding JVM Code Cache memory.

The failed health check error shows up regardless of the Code Cache memory size specified in the JVM parameters.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

This problem has multiple causes, so isn't directly reproducible.
h3. Expected Results

The troubleshooting tools only show up an error in Code Cache memory size when there's an actual problem
h3. Actual Results
An error is displayed even though the code cache size is adequate

h3. Workaround
 * The actual ReservedCodeCacheSize may still be too small. Increase it by following [Confluence crashes due to CodeCache is full. Compiler has been disabled|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/confluence-crashes-due-to-codecache-is-full-compiler-has-been-disabled-780864803.html] article.
 * Restart Confluence
fields.summary: Upgrading to ATST plugin v 1.23.1 gives false alarm for jvm code cache
Page tree should show something when there are no subpages

fields.description:
h3. Problem
Page positioning issue while navigating through multiple inline comments.

h3. Environment
Tests performed with Confluence versions 6.13.4 and 6.13.10, specifically for Data Center version to reach a similar environment to the customer.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Create a page with random content (customer used Lipsum Generator) and add the _Info, Note, Tip and Warning macros_ that come bundled with Confluence. Issue can also be reproduced with the Message Box Macro that is bundled with the Content Formatting for Confluence plugin version 6.4.3 from Adaptavist. 
* Add any of those macros to the page with the random content, and add inline comments to the plain text but also to the macros content, since those macros are meant to enhance the plain text.
* While navigating the multiple inline comments, it is noticeable the inline comments added to the text inside the macros, either the _Info, Note, Tip and Warning macros_ or the _Message Box Macro_ makes the positioning in the page be completely lost, since navigating through the inline comments seems to either ignore the inline comments inside the macros or makes the positioning of the page focus, that was supposed to be over the inline comment highlighted text, goes either to the beginning of the page, or to some random place in the middle or all the way to the bottom.

h3. Expected Results
Navigating through inline comments should allow the page focus to be over the highlighted text for the inline comment.

h3. Actual Results
Navigating through inline with macros _Info, Note, Tip and Warning macros_ or the _Message Box Macro from Adaptavist_ shows the same behaviour, which is the wrong focus for the page that contain inline comments inside those macros, making the navigation through the page erroneous.

h3. Workaround
No workaround available. Removing the macros allow the navigation through the inline comments to work properly, but it defeats the purpose of making it possible to focus the positioning of the page over the highlighted content.

h3. Notes

Customer test data and instructions:
- Confluence 6.13.10 (Data Center).
- Chrome version is currently 79.0.3945.88 (although the problem exists across other Chrome versions and at least on the Safari browser as well from one user on a Mac).
- The testing shows that there seems to be a bug with the Message Box macro from Adaptavist's app called Content Formatting for Confluence (currently running v6.4.3). The behavior is that although clicking the up/down arrows jumps the highlighting to the appropriate comment, it does not "give focus" to that comment if the comment is within a Message Box macro. Instead it either scrolls all the way to the top of the page, or the bottom of the page (seemingly determined by whichever is closer to the current position on the page). The only deviation from this is when the next comment is "in view" (visible) in the current browser window (adjusting the window size can be helpful to demonstrate this).
- The testing shows that there seems to be a bug with the Info, Note, Tip and Warning macros that come bundled with Confluence. The behavior is that although clicking the up/down arrows jumps the highlighting to the appropriate comment, it does not "give focus" to that comment if the comment is within one of those four macros. Instead it simply stays at the current position. The only deviation from this is when the next comment is "in view" (visible) in the current browser window (adjusting the window size can be helpful to demonstrate this).
- As the behaviors are very similar between the Adaptavist and Confluence macros, I suspect there is some underlying code (from the Confluence macros) that Adaptivist is using (or some of the same classes?).
fields.summary: Navigating through inline comments using the arrows breaks on basic pages

fields.description:
You might have a configuration control somewhere, but I cannot find it.

*Problem:* When you export a Confluence article to PDF or Word, the system does not remove the chevron and indent. As a side note, I'm not sure when the current behavior (or lack thereof) would be desirable.

*Proposed solution:* Provide a configuration control to remove the Chevron when you export an expended section to PDF and Word.
fields.summary: Add an option to remove the Chevron when you export an expended section to PDF and Word

fields.description:
h3. Problem
Add Inline comment fails to save when an *Expand* macro contains the same text in the title.
{panel:title=}
We can't add your inline comment; the section you highlighted may contain a macro or user mention. Try highlighting plain text.
{panel}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In Edit mode, add an *Expand* macro to the page. 
# Insert text in the Expand's title. 
# Add the same text anywhere on the page. 
# Save the page
# Highlight the text and click on *comment icon*.
# Add a comment and Save. 
Storage Format:
 [^StorageFormatInlineCommentError] 
h3. Expected Results
Added Inline comment to save without issue.
h3. Actual Results
Inline comment fails to add with prompt. 
 !inlinceCommentExpandMacroError.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Unable to create an inline comment when expand macro contains the same text in the title.

fields.description:
Please eliminate the need to cross-reference Confluence page titles in order to get the Creator field, by adding the Creator field as an option to the Confluence Tracking Column macro.

The absence of this fundamental field hampers efficient management of the Space.
fields.summary: Add "Creator" option to Confluence Tracking Column macro

fields.description: Every time I need to use instructional text it is an exercise in pain.  It is not possible to convert existing text to instructional text, and every time I try to paste text in the paste happens outside of the macro.  I can't cut and paste instructional text from one place to another, and overall, anytime I need to change templates around I spend more time on that text than anything else.  TERRIBLE.  This needs a fix.
fields.summary: Make Instructional Text easier to work with

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Images copied over from Jira Report Plugin don't render for anonymous users. However, all other content is viewable. 

(i) A login user can view all content. 
h3. Suggested Solution

 Enable anonymous users to view Jira macro images. 
h3. Why This Is Important

_Admin requires a way for anonymous users to view images copied over from the Jira report._ 
h3. Workaround

_Manually attach Images to page._ 
h3. How To Replicate
 # Create app link to Jira.
 ** !JiraAppLink.png|thumbnail!
 # Create a Jira gadget.
 ** !JiraGadget.png|thumbnail!
 # Create a page.
 # Copy and paste the Jira report from Jira to Confluence page.
 ** !confluence-userView.png|thumbnail!
 # enable anonymous users.
 # view page as an anonymous user.
 ** !anonymous users.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: JIRA Report Plug In - Images copied/pasted not saving locally on page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

As of today, users with the same first name will be assigned the same letter to their Collaborative text cursor.

If we take in consideration the behaviour we have under CONFSERVER-59400, the usability of our collaborative editing feature is considerably degraded
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page
 # Edit it with multiple users (be sure to have at least two of them with the same first name)

h3. Expected Results

We are able to discern between them easily
h3. Actual Results

Users will be assigned the same initial (first name initial), making it hard to discern between them. 
 If we take in consideration the behavior under CONFSERVER-59400, it becomes impossible to discern who is editing where.

Example being:

!SameColorSameLetter.jpg!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Allow users to select which letter will be used in their Collaborative editing text cursor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, it is possible for users to be assigned the same Text Cursor color. This causes confusion and makes collaboration harder.

This problem is increased when users have the same first name. In this situation, they can have the same color and letter to describe them within the editor.

Upon testing, it seems that we are able to cycle through ten different colors and the colors can be repeated.

+_The suggested resolution is to keep the editor from assigning the same color for more than one user and increase the color pool from which the system can select._+
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page in Confluence
 # Edit it with multiple users (preferably more than 10 users)
 # Make sure that Collaborative editing is turned on

 
h3. Expected Results

Every and each user has a different color to describe them
h3. Actual Results

Colors can be repeated, causing confusion:

!SameColorSameLetter.jpg!

 

 

 

 
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Assign different colors to all users editing a page with collaborative editing
User mentions broken in Templates after Space import

fields.description:
At the moment I can
 * change a favicon per Confluence Server
 * assign each Confluence Space an icon

However, I would love to have a favicon per Confluence Space since it would help with bookmarks and bookmark bars.
fields.summary: Add favicon per Confluence Space

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When the order of directories is changed, Gatekeeper is not aware of it and does not update its user cache.
h3. Environment

N/A
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure two directories with a user which exists in both directories
 # Change the order of directories

h3. Expected Results

User cache must contain the user from the directory with the highest priority
h3. Actual Results

User is not updated in user cache
h3. Notes
 # ApplicationDirectoryOrderUpdatedEvent is sent when the position of a directory is changed.
 # We receive the only one event. For example, we have two directories and moved one of them. Even though positions of both directories are changed, we will get one event only.

h3. Workaround

The system administrator can disable and then enable the plugin to make it refresh the user cache.
fields.summary: ApplicationDirectoryOrderUpdatedEvent is not taken into account by Gatekeeper

fields.description: h3. Issue Summary If a value is set for the alt property of an image that's embedded within a page, Confluence will display the _alt_ property name and it's value within the rendered HTML code. However, if no value is set for the _alt_ property, then Confluence will not display anything for the _alt_ property, including it's title. Ideally, the _alt_ property is outputted but with no value so that screen readers will not break when trying to process an embedded image. h3. Steps to Reproduce For a given image embedded within a Confluence page: # Edit the page. # Select the image and click on _Properties_. # Click on *Title*. # Leave the *Alt text* field blank. # Save the page. h3. Desired Results If you right click on the page to view the rendered HTML and locate the image tag containing the image, there should be a reference to the _alt_ property within the image tag like this: {code:java} {code} h3. Actual Results If you right click on the page to view the rendered HTML and locate the image tag containing the image, you'll notice that there's no reference of the _alt_ property within the image tag: {code:java} {code}
fields.summary: Rendering of blank Alt property within image tag

fields.description:
h3. Problem

After creating an Anchor on the page, the next step of *help* instructions says to _"type this"_ to create the link to the anchor and shows the syntax example as the hashtag sign and the word "anchorname" like this: *#anchorname .

This can create confusion when the user follows these exact steps.
h3. Suggested Solution

Suggest improving this by changing text to something along the lines of:
 * "Type the hashtag sign *"#"* and the name you gave the anchor..."

h3. Why This Is Important
 * Reduce user frustration
 * Make it easier to use the anchor link macro.
fields.summary: Anchor link usage instructions are misleading

fields.description:

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Creating a "Meeting note" template hangs when the Content Report macro is used. This error only appears when there's not meeting notes in selected space.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create two spaces.
 ** Space A
 ** Space B
 # On Space A, create a new page and add the "Content Report Table" macro.
 # On the settings of the macro, use:
 ** Labels: meeting-notes
 ** Space: Space B

h3. Expected Results

The space shows the Meeting Notes panel with an AUI themed blue Create meeting note button. Clicking this button should display a pop-up window briefly, and then show the blank meeting note page.
h3. Actual Results

The pop-up window displays with a spinning busy indicator and never goes away. Clicking the Next button does nothing. Clicking the Close button will close the pop-up. The blue Create meeting note button is now gone from the original page. Refreshing the page will restore the button repeating the cycle.
h3. Workaround

Create one meeting notes manually by using the top Create button.
fields.summary: Can't create Meeting Notes template when using the Content Report Table macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Windows Installer shows "com.install4j.runtime.beans.action.control.RunScriptAction" dialog error during upgrade when Confluence was installed as a non-service.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Install Confluence 6.15.9 using Windows Installer *but did not install as Windows Service*. i.e. Confluence started up as Batch File (It only occurs when upgrading from when Installer explicitly mentions not to install as service)
2. Upgrade to Confluence 7.3.0 Beta 1
3. Windows never ever seems to be able to shutdown Confluence! - https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-59344
4. Manually shutdown Tomcat
5. Fails with an error during Install Folder deletion 
 !error_during_upgrade.png|thumbnail! 
6. Had to press Ignore once and it then proceeded through
7. Upgrade did complete successfully 

h3. Expected Results

The error dialog box should not have shown and the upgrade completes successfully.

h3. Actual Results

This error dialog box is shown:

 !error_during_upgrade.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Press ignore and Install should complete without any further errors.
fields.summary: Windows Installer shows "com.install4j.runtime.beans.action.control.RunScriptAction" dialog error during Upgrade

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On new installations the Global blueprints are not populated which also causes an empty template page under Space Tools until a user clicks the ••• '*Create from template*' button.

Note you do not need to create a page from a blueprint/template, you can close the window. All that is required is you click three ••• next to create. Then the Global Blueprints are populated and Space Tools now shows templates.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Fresh Confluence installation (Or one where no one has clicked *Create from template*)
 # Go to:  !https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/files/747833194/747833195/2/1517274813281/cog.png! *> General Configuration > Global Templates and Blueprints*
 ## Notice there are only 3 Space blueprints and 3 System templates - missing the *Global page blueprints*
 # Go to a *Space > Space Tools > Content Tools > Templates*
 ## Notice there are zero templates listed
 # Click the ••• *Create from template* button
 # Close the window without creating a page
 # Go to Global Templates and Blueprints or Space Tools templates and you will now see a fully populated list. *Global page blueprints* are now listed under Global Templates and Blueprint templates are listed under Space Tools templates.

h3. Expected Results

All available templates are loaded and available to edit upon install before clicking on *Create from template* or creating a page from a template.
 Perhaps triggered during the onboard process for example.
h3. Actual Results

No Global page blueprints are listed or any templates under Space Tools.
 The only default blueprints under Global templates are the following:
 * Knowledge base
 * Team Space
 * Documentation

h3. Workaround

You must click on ••• *Create from template*. There is no need to actually create a page, you can either close the window or create a page and the blueprints/templates will now be populated.
fields.summary: Global page blueprints and Space templates are not populated until ••• 'Create from template' is clicked

fields.description:
h3. Problem

When admin is executing space export to pdf for personal spaces, the restricted pages are not exporting. However, if the admin adds can view and edit permissions, the page is exported.

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Check admin has global permission
# Check admin has permission to view, edit, restriction, export in space permission.
# Create a user in confluence-user group. 
# Login as new user.
# Create a personal space.
# Create a page with restrictions with user having only view and edit rights.
# Create a child page without restrictions. 
# Create a page that's not child without restrictions. 
# Login as admin. 
# Navigate to space *content tools* > Export > Export to PDF. 
# Download. 
# Next navigate to page with restrictions and add view and edit rights. 
# Navigate to space *content tools* > Export > Export to PDF. 
# Download. 

h3. Expected Results
Export to PDF have all pages if admin has export rights. 
 [^AdminAddedToRestrictions.pdf] 

h3. Actual Results
Any restricted pages are not exported to PDF
 [^personalSpaceAdminExport.pdf]
fields.summary: Admin has permission to export, view and other administration permissions. If the space export to pdf function is attempted, any restricted pages not inclusive to admin are not exported to pdf.

h3. Summary

In [Subscribe to Team Calendars from Apple Calendar|https://confluence.atlassian.com/teamcal/subscribe-to-team-calendars-from-apple-calendar-686857285.html]:
{quote}
h3. Subscribe with two-way synchronization (CalDAV)

Two-way synchronization allows you to view and update Team Calendars events in {color:#de350b}*iOS*{color}. It requires Team Calendars 6.0 or later. 

These instructions are for Apple Calendar 10.0 on MacOS High Sierra. Your version may differ slightly.

As the instructions state they are for macOS High Sierra, the sentence above could be changed to:

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Updating Atlassian Troubleshooting and Support Tools to the latest version 1.23.1 breaks the MySQL character set and collation health check which fails incorrectly.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Confluence is connected to MySQL and you have verified your encoding and collation is correct utf8/utf8_bin
 # Update ATST to the latest version 1.23.1
 # Go to: *General Configuration > Troubleshooting and support tools*
 # Notice the following errors:
{quote}Encoding: What does this check do?
 Checks if the collation used by the tables, columns, and database defaults in your MySQL database is correct.
 Result
 Exception during health check invocation java.lang.RuntimeException: java.sql.SQLException: You can't operate on a closed ResultSet!!!
{quote}
{quote}Collation: What does this check do?
 Checks if the character set used by the tables, columns, and database defaults in your MySQL database is correct.

Result
 Exception during health check invocation java.lang.RuntimeException: java.sql.SQLException: You can't operate on a closed ResultSet!!!
{quote}

h3. Expected Results

The test should pass as the error is only thrown after updating ATST without any changes made to the DB.
h3. Actual Results

The collation and encoding MySQL health checks fail

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
2020-01-22 12:09:46,201 WARN [HealthCheckWatchdog:thread-7] [troubleshooting.healthcheck.concurrent.SupportHealthCheckTask] healthCheckError Unable to complete execution of health check Collation due to an exception │
│ -- referer: http://localhost:26154/c6154/plugins/servlet/troubleshooting/view/ | url: /c6154/rest/troubleshooting/1.0/check/process/ | traceId: b67f511ec9773af8 | userName: admin                                     │
│java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException: java.lang.RuntimeException: java.sql.SQLException: You can't operate on a closed ResultSet!!!
{noformat}
h3. Workaround
h5. Option 1 - Disable the MySQL modules
 # Go to:  !https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/files/747833194/747833195/2/1517274813281/cog.png! *> Manage Apps >* Expand *Atlassian Troubleshooting and Support Tools >* Expand *modules* > Disable the following *modules*:
 ## *confluence.healthcheck.mysql.character.set.name*
 ## *confluence.healthcheck.mysql.collation.name*

h5. Option 2 - Downgrade ATST to the previous version 1.22.0
 # Download ATST 1.22.0 from [here|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/download/apps/1217697/version/12200001]
 # Shutdown Confluence
 # Go to *<CONF-INSTALL>/conlfuence/WEB-INF/atlassian-bundled-plugins*
 # Backup and delete the file *plugin-confluence-1.22.0.jar* and *replace* with the downloaded 1.22.0 version
 # [Clear the plug-in cache|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-clear-confluence-plugins-cache-297664846.html]
 # Start Confluence

 * For some reason, this was not enough to downgrade the plugin, if it still fails, follow on:
 * (!) *Please remember* to take a database backup before making any changes.

 # Shutdown Confluence
 # Follow [Manually remove plugin from DB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-manually-remove-malfunctioning-add-ons-113705118.html]
 ## Run the following query:
{code:java}
select PLUGINDATAID, PLUGINKEY, FILENAME, LASTMODDATE from PLUGINDATA;
{code}
 ## You should see the ASTS 1.23.1 listed, similar to below:
{code:sql}
PLUGINDATAID PLUGINKEY                                       FILENAME                                                LASTMODDATE         
------------ ----------------------------------------------- ------------------------------------------------------- ------------------- 
1081345      com.atlassian.troubleshooting.plugin-confluence plugin.1358229087590107522.plugin-confluence-1.23.1.jar 2020-01-22 12:41:34{code}
 ## Run the following query using the PLUGINDATAID from above for the ATST plugin - in this example it's *_1081345_*:
{code:java}
delete from PLUGINDATA where PLUGINDATAID=XXXXXX;{code}
 # [Clear the plug-in cache|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-clear-confluence-plugins-cache-297664846.html].
 # Start Confluence
 # You should now find the ATST version has been downgraded to 1.22.0. You can confirm from the UPM and also the health check will now pass.
fields.summary: Updating ATST Troubleshooting and Support Tools breaks MySQL health checks

fields.description:
h3. Note - This bug doesn't affect version 6.x. It is affecting version 7.x
h3. Summary

When several blogs are created on the same day, they are not getting sorted based on created DateTime. The last blog created appears at the end of the blog list.
h3. How to replicate
 # Create a blog post called "Blog 1".
 # Add some content. Close the editor and save it.
 # Create another blog post and publish it as "Blog 2".
 # Add some content to Blog 2. Close the editor and save it.
 # Create another blog post and publish it as "Blog 3".
 # Add some content to Blog 3. Close the editor and save it.

h3. Expected results

On the Blog post page, the order of the blogs should be like below
 * Blog 3
 * Blog 2
 * Blog 1

h3. Actual results

The blogposts are instead listed in this order (top to bottom):
 * Blog 1
 * Blog 2
 * Blog 3

h3. Note

The blog created on the next day will appear at the top of the blog page list. For e.g., if Blog 4 is created on the next days, the order of the blogs in the blog list is
 * Blog 4
 * Blog 1
 * Blog 2
 * Blog 3
fields.summary: Blogposts created same day are not sorted correctly

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When adding the Confluence pages gadget to a Jira dashboard twice, will cause Jira to fail the authentication on the second gadget upon the auto-refresh if other gadgets are present on the dashboard.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add the Confluence Pages gadget twice to a dashboard.
 # Configure it to auto-refresh after 15 minutes.
 # Add other gadgets to the dashboard.
 # Wait for the gadgets to auto-refresh.

h3. Expected Results

The dashboard should update both Confluence Pages gadgets and display the linked pages.
h3. Actual Results

The first gadget does authenticate correctly and updates its contents, but the second gadget instance fails to authenticate.
h3. Workaround

Don't add other gadgets to the same dashboard.
fields.summary: Adding the Confluence Pages gadget twice in a dashboard causes the second gadget to fail the authentication with Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a template with a macro that links to content is created and, subsequently , creating a page from it. The links are stripped from the macro.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page template.
 # Insert a macro that links to some resource, e.g., an excerpt macro linking to a page. This happens with other macros that link to content as well.
 # Save the template and create a page from it or edit it again
 # Instead of the linked content and random error is thrown.

h3. Expected Results

Macros show linked content
h3. Actual Results

Nothing is shown on logs. Macro does not have the link to the content. The links are replaced with *unnamed link*.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround fro this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Creating a page from a template with macro remove the links on the macros

fields.description:
We use the Confluence Blogpost macro a lot as that is the first thing people see on our intranet when they open Confluence. To make sure people get the newest content first we want to show them the blogposts sorted by publication date.

Instead we only have the option to sort by _title_ _creation date_ and _modified_ which is not the ordering we want to show. 

It's strange that the concept of _publication date_ is very prominent on blogposts but we cannot use it in the Blogpost macro. 

That is a major missing feature for us as the other 3 options fail to show us newly published blogposts that have not been modified and created recently.
fields.summary: Blogpost macro should allow sort by publication date

fields.description:
h1. observed behavior

Using a third-party macro (specifically, {{Bitbucket file}} from the {{}}[Include Bitbucket add-on|[https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1212529/include-bitbucket-for-confluence?hosting=cloud&tab=support]], I included a Markdown file in a confluence page for reference.

The TOC macro obviously parsed the page AND the included file and now also contains the headings of Markdown file. They are inserted at the respective level (i.e. level 1 of the markdown is also level 1 of the page) and thus break the existing page layout. 

Also, the links then don't work.

The only way to work around this is to exclude all headings from the markdown in the TOC macro. But as the Markdown file is obviously edited on Bitbucket, this filtering will not work for long...
h1. steps to reproduce
 # create a page with the TOC macro and some headings (best shown if you have mutliple levels)
 # include a markdown file with some headings using the {{Bitbucket file}} macro
 # Check the generated TOC

h1. expected behavior

The markdown file is not parsed and not included in the TOC, keeping the page layout intact.
h1. suggestion

Either:
 * provide a filter to exclude the content of specific macros from being parsed and used in the TOC macro

Or:
 * parse the content of the macro and insert it a level below the current header level.

h1. background

I wasn't sure whether to post this as a bug or as a suggestion. Seeing that [creating the TOC from HTML pages (see bullet under "Notes and known issues"|[https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/table-of-contents-macro-182682099.html]] seems to describe a similar but wanted behavior, I guess that having this could also be considered expected behavior.

If you create your page from multiple other pages, this seems fine. But for documentation purposes including markdown files (README.md, mostly) but having them collapsed is something we do quite often. This provides all required info in one place, but having this content show up in the TOC is distracting and creates more confusion.

If required, I'm happy to provide more details and / or  screenshots of a sample page which illustrates the issue.
fields.summary: Don't add headings from included files to TOC macro

fields.description:
The Confluence "code" block does not support Prolog. Please add it (not sure how difficult that is though; or is there a way to wire up one's own?).

Inappropriate syntax highlighting ensues and one has to manually set the style to "plain text" (because the widget's attempt at doing something useful fails), or maybe "Erlang" which is kinda, sorta similar.

Example (here, in Jira, but I suppose the underlying widget is the same as the one in Confluence. The style is set to "java".
 
From https://rosettacode.org/wiki/100_doors#Prolog

{code:java}
 main :-
    forall(between(1,100,Door), ignore(display(Door))).
 
% show output if door is open after the 100th pass
display(Door) :-
    status(Door, 100, open),
    format("Door ~d is open~n", [Door]).
 
% true if Door has Status after Pass is done
status(Door, Pass, Status) :-
    Pass > 0,
    Remainder is Door mod Pass,
    toggle(Remainder, OldStatus, Status),
    OldPass is Pass - 1,
    status(Door, OldPass, OldStatus).
status(_Door, 0, closed).
 
toggle(Remainder, Status, Status) :-
    Remainder > 0.
toggle(0, open, closed).
toggle(0, closed, open).{code}
fields.summary: Confluence "{code}" block does not support Prolog syntax highlighting

# Restart Confluence

h3. Expected Results

The Last Occurrence of the OpenJDK should be when the last occurrence was.

h3. Actual Results

The OpenJDK line is *5 days ago* (today 17th, log line 12th) so expected Last Occurrence to be *5 days ago*:

{code}
2020-01-12 18:56:45,484 INFO [localhost-startStop-1] [confluence.admin.actions.SystemInfoOnStartup] startup 
...
..
javaVm = OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM
javaRuntime = OpenJDK Runtime Environment
...
{code}

However, ATST » Log Analyzer is showing it is 10 hours ago (x):

 !log_scanner.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround

N/A

fields.summary: Increase visibility of current date highlight on calendar

fields.description:
Last day it happened that a user wanted to share a Confluence page to a group of some people. He accidentally selected the wrong group and so he shared to > 1,000 people. And all of them received an email notification, which was considered as spam by most of them and so we had a huge discussion about security and how to avoid sending email notification to such a huge number of people. I did not find a solution to limitate email notifications for Confluence.

 

I know from Outlook, if one tries to send an email to distribution list with more than 100 people, Outlook displays a warning "are you sure to send to >100 people?".

 

So my feature request is: I'd like to have such a warning also displayed in Confluence when someone tries to share a page to more than 100 people.
fields.summary: Display a warning before sharing a page to a lot of people

h3. Problem Definition
Thanks to CONFSERVER-19389, users can choose whether attachments is copied on page copy. But the "Include attached files and images" checkbox is enabled by default, and there is no option to change the default value. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a global configuration to set the default value of the option.
fields.summary: Make default value of "Include attached files and images" checkbox on page copy configurable

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When @ mentioning users on a Confluence page, users are not found if bracketed text is entered.

+For example+:
 Fullname = 홍길동(Gildong Hong)

Searching for @Gil doesn't find anything, but searching for @(Gil works fine. The administrator does not expect users to add the bracket symbol, as some users are known by english names or nicknames in brackets. Administrators also don't expect users to use the workaround of prefixing bracketed names with [~ 
 For example: [~Gil
h3. Suggested Solution

Relax the fuzzy search distances in the fuze.js plugin to find bracketed usernames, like JIRA currently allows.

Having the user mentions in Confluence work the same way as JIRA would provide a more consistent user search experience across popular Atlassian products.
h3. Workaround

To @ mention names like above, you can either:
 a) Include the bracket character as part of the name. Using the example above, @(Gil 
 or
 b) Prefix the bracketed name with [~ For example: [~Gil
fields.summary: When mentioning users, the user search flexibility needs to be configurable to find bracketed names

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Illegal reflective access warnings appear in the logs after upgrading to Confluence 7.1 and moving to Java 11.

h3. Environment

* Confluence 7.1+
* Java 11 (Oracle or Adopt)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Startup Confluence
# Tail the catalina logs

h3. Expected Results

No warnings are printed.

h3. Actual Results

After startup, we can see the following warnings on *catalina.out*:

{code}
2019-10-18 18:47:38,130 INFO [Catalina-utility-2] [com.atlassian.confluence.lifecycle] contextInitialized Starting Confluence 7.1.0-beta1 [build 8301 based on commit hash a7410a32cef94e8ae9db6d445445e6e9482fcb3f] - synchrony version 3.1.0-master-8becbfc8
WARNING: An illegal reflective access operation has occurred
WARNING: Illegal reflective access by com.atlassian.hibernate.adapter.proxy.BytecodeProviderImpl_ImplementV2Proxy (file:/confluence/WEB-INF/lib/hibernate.adapter-1.0.3.jar) to field java.lang.reflect.Field.modifiers
WARNING: Please consider reporting this to the maintainers of com.atlassian.hibernate.adapter.proxy.BytecodeProviderImpl_ImplementV2Proxy
WARNING: Use --illegal-access=warn to enable warnings of further illegal reflective access operations
WARNING: All illegal access operations will be denied in a future release
{code}
 
h3. Notes

# No side effect caused by this illegal access operation could be noticed
# The messages above are *not* printed when starting Confluence 7.1+ with Java 8, tested with AdoptOpenJDK jdk8u192-b12

h3. Workaround

No known workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Illegal reflective access warnings after Confluence startup

fields.description:
Restriction feature in Confluence could be enhanced with ability to let users actually see restricted content exist and therefore request access if it seems relevant for them.

Today, restricted content is not visible at all for all users which are not authorized and they are only aware of its existence when they have page URL and they can't open the content. But, in some cases, it will be helpful to directly present links to such content in page tree (ideally with a pad lock in front of Title to directly inform content is indeed restricted for given user), so user can easily request access to content owners.

*Reasons :*
 * Broader awareness of restricted content (Spaces or sections are not "empty" or "missing info", users simply don't have access to content due to restrictions)
 * Avoidance of restricted content duplicates (Users are recreating similar content thinking it doesn't exist)
 * Ease access request as users can directly see content which is indeed restricted for them.
 * Ability to distinguish restricted content for limited users (not visible at all) and restricted content for larger audience (links in page tree).

*Limits:*
 * It should remain possible to not show restricted content titles in Page tree. 

*Look'n feel*

An extra option in current restriction drop down menu.

"Limited viewing and editing restricted - Everyone can view Titles in Page tree, only some can fully view and edit" to be placed 3rd position between "Editing restricted" and "Viewing and editing restricted".
fields.summary: Awareness of restricted content

fields.description:
While upgrading Confluence in Windows via Installer, sometimes the running version of Confluence can't be stopped. This ends up in pop-up Errors in installer. 

It will be good to have the following messages in pop-up, when this situation happens

# Confluence might be running, please shut it down before upgrading

This will make admins more aware of the scenario.

Regarding this documentation: ['Can't get a secure connection' error on Confluence Server mobile app|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/can-t-get-a-secure-connection-error-on-confluence-server-mobile-app-940695063.html]

[Requirements for trusted certificates in iOS 13 and macOS 10.15|https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT210176]

fields.description: When a new blog is created, by default the publish date goes to when the post/draft was first initiated, rather than the date it actually ends up being published. If the author neglects to change the publish date using the optional field while still in draft, they have no recourse to correct it, which becomes a problem for users who start drafts weeks or months ahead of when they are published. If CONFSERVER-11740 is not going to be implemented any time soon, perhaps this is an alternative solution that may be easier to do.
fields.summary: Set blog post date to the date it was published, not started

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When the sandbox conversion fails (OOM, timeout, etc), the JVM kills the sandbox abruptly instead of killing it gracefully. I suspect the Aspose conversion library uses something like deleteOnExit(), which means that for the temporary font files it creates, no delete method is ever called given how we kill the sandbox so suddenly.

This might have other negative side effects that we don't know about, so we should attempt to kill the sandbox gracefully before we SIGKILL it.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

By looking at the java.io.tmpdir while we kill the Sandbox, we can see the difference between killing gracefully and not killing gracefully:
{code:java}
# kill sandbox gracefully, does clean up 
$ ls | grep .tmp | wc -l 
25 
$ kill 30667 
$ ls | grep .tmp | wc -l 
0 

# kill sandbox with SIGKILL, does not clean up 
$ ls | grep .tmp | wc -l 
25 
$ kill -9 30883 
$ ls | grep .tmp | wc -l 
25
# when another sandbox is created, there will now be 50 tmp files {code}
h3. Expected Results

Files are always cleaned up, even when sandbox crashes.
h3. Actual Results

Not killing gracefully means that Aspose conversion library does not clean up tmp files properly. See above for how to reproduce.
h3. Workaround
The location these tmp files are saved comes from the java.io.tmpdir parameter. A possible workaround for this issue could be to set that to a directory that gets cleaned up regularly by a scheduled job, for example <confluence-home>/temp.
{code:java}
-Dconversion.sandbox.java.options=-Djava.io.tmpdir=<confluence-home>/temp{code}
fields.summary: Sandbox should try to gracefully die

h3. Issue Summary

When adding Confluence RSS feeds to MS Teams, the attempt will result in "Enter a valid RSS feed address" error. The same error is logged pre-configured, generated, anonymous or feeds with authentication parameters in them. Feed will continue to work on all other RSS Feed Readers
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create RSS Feed URL
 # Open MS Team RSS Feed Module
 # Attempt to add Feed URL into MS Feeds

h3. Expected Results

Feed is added
h3. Actual Results

MS Teams will fail to load the feed with "Enter a valid RSS feed address" error bellow
 !Screen Shot 2020-01-13 at 06.42.15.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

h3. Note:
MS Teams uses NodeJS RSS parser which does not support certain RSS URLs including those generated by Confluence.

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Some Word documents are embedded with other documents such other word documents or powepoint documents. 

Importing such Word file into Confluence to be converted to a Confluence page, will not upload these attachments. Instead, these attachments will be displayed as a an image. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Word file that has another embedded Word document. 
 ## To do this open Word > *Insert > Object* 
 ## **Select the type of object that will be attached and embed it to the Word document. 
 # Head over to *Confluence* *>* any space. 
 # Click *... >>* Import Word Document 
 # Upload the above word document from *1* and complete the wizard. 

h3. Expected Results

The word document will be converted to Confluence page, and the embedded document will be uploaded as an attachment to this page. 
h3. Actual Results

The word document will be converted to Confluence page. However, the embedded document do not get uploaded an in its place an image of the embedded document will be uploaded. 
h3. Workaround

Manually upload the embedded documents to the Confluence page.
fields.summary: Embedded documents in a Word document do not get imported to Confluence

We would like to use the Contributors Summary Macro to count how often each person has created pages in a subarea to determine the person in charge to create the next journal (which is the one that has created least pages).

The Contributors Summary Macro seems to be a good fit from first sight, however, we are missing an option for the parameter column to only count created (not updated) pages per user. It should be a minor change from Atlassian's side but would be a great relief for us.

fields.description:
Confluence currently doesn't have an intuitive way to work with Licensing and Licensed User seats. See this feature request for background on this topic:  https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-54271

Atlassian has since released a plugin to help administrators find which users are counting towards a license called the *Central License Availability* plugin: [https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1220745/centralized-license-visibility]

And while the plugin doesn't ultimately solve the UI request (Crowd DC is required to take advantage of that feature), it does remove hurdles for admins who need to pull lists of active users counting towards a license with all types of implentations. 

This [popular KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-get-a-list-of-active-users-counting-towards-the-confluence-license-298978076.html] can be used in some situations, however it has major caveats with respect to LDAP nested groups and duplicate users across directories. Both of these caveats can be safely ignored when leveraging the Central Visibility plugin. As a result, we would request that the plugin is bundled with Confluence files moving forward to aid in license management.
fields.summary: Bundle Central License Availability plugin with Confluence

fields.description:
The trash does not indicate when a page was deleted. Add a column that shows what day something was deleted to make recovery easier.

 

The issue is if a page or series of pages are deleted by mistake and you do not know the title, it is hard to track down what was deleted. A timestamp or a date deleted field for each item in the trash would help resolve this because you could track back to the rough time range the pages were deleted and find all the others deleted at the same time.
fields.summary: Trash - Timestamp & date deleted

fields.description:
Today I learned that a user who:
* Has space admin permission
* Does not have delete attachment permission (which they could totally grant themself)

When trying to delete attachmens:
* Cannot delete attachments
* *Can* delete versions of attachments. (including *the last* version of an attachment)

I don't believe gatekeeper discusses this, and I guess effective permissions probably should.

Our attachment documentation correctly documents the above, although it doesn't exactly call it out:

{quote}
Delete an attached file
You'll need the 'Delete Attachment' space permission to delete an attached file. 

To delete all versions of an attached file:

Go to the page that contains the attachment.
Go to  > Attachments
Choose Delete next to the attachment you want to delete.
Choose Delete to confirm your action.
Deleted files can be restored from the trash. You'll need to be a space admin to do this. 

Space Admins can also delete a specific versions of an attachment:

Go to  > Attachments
Click the expand arrow next to the attachment name to see the list of attachment versions
Choose Delete next to the version you want to delete.
Deleted file versions are not recoverable from the trash.
{quote}

Sidenote for [~rrobins]:  "*a* specific version{*}s*"

I don't know if anybody cares about this.
fields.summary: Attachment History can be removed without Delete Attachment permission

fields.description:
When watching a page I expect to get emails when comments are added, and when they edited.

I've noticed recently that the notifications are not coming when the comment edit happens. This makes it difficult for me - I rely on notifications to keep up with discussion, then come to the page ready to reply to a particular comment, only to notice later that the actual text of the comment has been updated, making my reply either moot or invalid.
fields.summary: No email notifications when a comment is edited

fields.description:
The space permission "Restrictions Add/Delete" allows users to alter the page restrictions of any page they have access to. 
Please implement an additional space permission that allows users to only alter the page restrictions of a page they created themselves. In essence, this would work like the "Delete own" permission.

Currently, it is possible for users to alter the page restrictions of a page created by someone else, without the original author knowing.

This has already been discussed in 2012, with no solution: https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-questions/I-need-to-restrict-my-restrictions-on-a-page/qaq-p/20744
fields.summary: Limiting the "Restrictions Add/Delete" permission to own pages

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

LDAP directories defined in *Confluence Administration* » *User Directories* stops auto-syncing on the synchronisation interval.

h3. Environment

* Confluence connected to an LDAP directory with a sync interval of 2 minutes

h3. Steps to Reproduce / Diagnose:

 # Install Confluence
 # Connect Confluence to an LDAP directory with a sync interval of 2 minutes
 # Enable the following DEBUG
{code}
com.atlassian.confluence.importexport
com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.CaesiumSchedulerService
{code}
 # Watching {{atlassian-confluence.log}}, it will sync with LDAP every 2 minutes
 # Drop the XML Space import zip into the Restore Directory
 # Through Confluence Administration, perform the Space Import and immediately close the Administration page as soon as you press *Restore*

(this is just a sample reproducible scenario)

h3. Expected Results

# We see in the logs that Confluence does unschedule the LDAP job but once the Space import is complete, it should re-enable the LDAP scheduled job

h3. Actual Results

# We see this in the log when the LDAP job is unscheduled
{code}
2019-11-20 12:30:43,929 DEBUG [Long running task: Importing data] [scheduler.caesium.impl.CaesiumSchedulerService] unscheduleJob unscheduleJob: com.atlassian.crowd.manager.directory.monitor.poller.DirectoryPollerManager.1015809
{code}
# It never gets added back in by Confluence even and hence, the LDAP job no longer syncs on the configured sync interval

h3. Workaround

* Restart Confluence to reset the LDAP job

(i) If Confluence is running as Data Center, shutdown all nodes, then start up each node, one at a time
fields.summary: LDAP auto-synchronisation stops after a Space Import

fields.description:

  {panel}

fields.description:
h3. Problem
After opening a link and refreshing a page by pressing return (enter) on the address bar in Chrome the page refreshes an HTTP address

h3. Environment
* Chrome 
* Confluence configured for SSL ([redirecting all HTTP traffic to HTTPS |https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/running-confluence-over-ssl-or-https-161203.html#RunningConfluenceOverSSLorHTTPS-Step5.AddasecurityconstrainttoredirectallURLstoHTTPS])

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Open Confluence in Chrome
* Open a Confluence link on a new page (Cmd + Click)
* Refresh the page by putting cursor in the address bar

(i) Recording *failure.mov* attached showing success and failure

h3. Expected Results
* Page refreshes with same HTTPS url successfully

h3. Actual Results
* The page attempts to load using HTTP and fails with "Bad Request This combination of host and port requires TLS." (see *error.png*)

h3. Workaround
* Issue is not reproducible in other browsers
* Refresh using Cmd (ctrl) + R

h3. Notes
* Not all pages are affected, but no clear pattern
fields.summary: Chrome New Tab Refresh Directs to HTTP
Correct 'Assign Space Permissions' documentation
Update user's profile picture via REST API

fields.description:
Add possibility to set maxHttpHeaderSize using environment variable ATL_TOMCAT_MAXHTTPHEADERSIZE.
 Default should remain unchanged at 8192.

This cloud be accomplished by changing config/server.xml.j2:
{code:java}
---a/config/server.xml.j2
+++ b/config/server.xml.j2
@@ -28,7 +28,7 @@
                relaxedPathChars="[]|"
                relaxedQueryChars="[]|{}^\`"<>"
                bindOnInit="false"
-               maxHttpHeaderSize="8192"
+               maxHttpHeaderSize="{{ atl_tomcat_maxhttpheadersize | default('8192') }}"
                useBodyEncodingForURI="true"
                disableUploadTimeout="true" />
{code}
 If you give me push rights, i will upload a feature branch containing the fix.
fields.summary: docker image: maxHttpHeaderSize by environment variable

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When a long URL is included in a Jira issue and displayed in the Jira Issues Macro, the wrapping behavior makes the table much wider than desired in Chrome/Safari. The table is so wide that users must scroll sideways within the table.

In Firefox, the wrapping behavior is as desired and no sideways scrolling is necessary.

It appears this long URL wrapping issue can be reproduced outside of Atlassian products by putting a long URL into this test site:

[https://www.w3schools.com/cssref/tryit.asp?filename=trycss_text_white-space]

The {{white-space: normal}} property wraps the long URL onto three lines in Firefox:
 !GoodWrap_Firefox.png|thumbnail! 
 The {{white-space: normal}} property wraps the long URL onto just two lines in Chrome:
 !BadWrap_Chrome.png|thumbnail!
h4. Behavior in Confluence

Good behavior in Confluence using Firefox:
 !GoodWrap_Firefox_Confluence.png|thumbnail!

Bad behavior in Confluence using Chrome:
 [^BadWrap_Chrome_Confluence.mp4]
h3. Suggested Solution

Make long URLs wrap in Chrome and Safari at a length that does not make the user need to scroll sideways.
h3. Workaround

View the page in Firefox.

We notice that tables in Confluence are forcing a wrap on the cells based on a percentage or pixel value, which seems to avoid this issue.
 (?) Can we take advantage of this fact to get the Jira Issue Macro to behave similarly?
 (?) As a workaround, can we make a custom macro or modify the CSS wrap to get the desired behavior?
fields.summary: When a long URL is displayed in Jira Issues Macro, the table is too wide in Chrome/Safari.

CONFSERVER-18824 was raised to suggest the {{*maxClauseCount*}} to be configurable but the request has been closed. The same problem can be replicated with direct CQL searches, not only through the macros. h3. Workaround # Refine the filter to have a lesser page involved in the search. It can be done by adding more criteria so the search don't hit the 1024 limit. # Or, if you are using the *parent* CQL parameter, switch to *ancestor*
fields.summary: Page Properties Report Macro show maxClauseCount is set to 1024 when the search filter is too large

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In the code block macro, it's only possible to add additional languages, but not to add a custom color theme via the UI.

h3. Suggestion
Provide ability to customize theme per color via UI
fields.summary: Ability to customize color theme via UI in code block macro

fields.description:
h3. Steps to replicate
 # *Stop Confluence*
 # Change the following property in <confluence-home>/*confleunce.cfg.xml*:
{code:java}
<property name="webwork.multipart.saveDir">${confluenceHome}/temp</property>
{code}
to the following path:
{code:java}
<property name="webwork.multipart.saveDir">/home/foo/confluence-temp/test</property>
{code}

 # *Start Confluence*
 # Export *a page* to PDF.

h3. Expected Behaviour

Confluence should prompt the PDF export file download.
h3. Actual Behaviour

Confluence return a Page Not Found in the UI pointing tot he following URL:
{code:java}
http://localhost:8090/download/home/foo/confluence-temp/test/pdfexport-20200101-010120-1436-9/TES-Testing-010120-1436-10.pdf?contentType=application/pdf
{code}
h3. Notes
 * *PDF export file generated at the new location* despite the Page Not Found.
 * (i) The issue does not persist for *PDF export of a Space*.

h3. Workaround

No workaround.
fields.summary: PDF exports of a Page return a Page Not Found after changing the path to the temp directory in confluence.cfg.xml

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Preview/Excel macro uses US date format (MM/DD/YYYY) for Excel documents containing dates in European format (DD/MM/YYYY)


h3. Environment
* Confluence 7.2



h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create MS Excel document. 
# Add date to one of the spreadsheet cells in European Format for example 30.12.2019 or 30/12/2019
# Create new page upload above document to the page. 
# Add new Excel macro and by using previously uploaded Excel document 
# Save the page
# Preview the page,

h3. Expected Results

Date from the spreadsheet cell is displayed as 30/12/2019



h3. Actual Results
Date from the spreadsheet cell is displayed as 12/30/2019

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

h3. Additional notes
Above bug occurs regardless of user language profile setting or global language setting in Confluence
fields.summary: Preview/Excel macro uses US date format (MM/DD/YYYY) for Excel documents containing dates in European format (DD/MM/YYYY)

fields.description:
h3. Desciption

When using a date picker in a Confluence page in other languages the month is shown incorrectly. It appears to have a null or blank after the month and year.
h3. Environment

Confluence 7.2.0
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change the profile language to a non US/UK language
 # Create a new Confluence page and add a date
 # The picker is shown with the month and the incorrect translation or bug

h3. Expected Results

The month and year is shown correctly without any suffix.
h3. Actual Results

In Russian, the month and year is shown as "Сентябрь 2019нет"
 In German, the month and year is shown as "September 2019Null"
 In Finnish, the month and year is shown as "Syyskuu 2019tyhjä"

!date picker.gif|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Null is shown in date picker

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Searching of an image in Insert Image and Files filter doesn't return any results if an alphanumeric word is used for search when the indexing language is set to Custom Japanese
h3. Steps to Reproduce
This is only applicable when indexing is set to Custom Japanese
1. Attached files to some pages
e.g ABC001.JPG,ABC002.JPG,ABC003.JPG
2. On a new page  go to insert files and images
3. Search on other pages
4. Search with ABC -> find 3 files. 
5. Search with ABC0 -> No search results found. 
6. Search with ABC002->No search results are found

h3. Expected Results
The search should return the image name if the alphanumeric text is used
h3. Actual Results
It returns no results


h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Searching of an image in Insert Image and Files filter doesn't return any results if an alphanumeric word is used for search when indexing language is set to Custom Japanese

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Trying to select text from a single Header Row Cell does not work. We need to either select nothing or all header cells.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page
 # Insert a table with header row
 # Try to select the text within that header row

h3. Expected Results

Only the desired text is highlighted
h3. Actual Results

No text is highlighted or every header cell is highlighted.

 

!HeaderTextHighlightServer.gif|width=501,height=189!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Selecting text on a table header row does not work
